info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:09PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rio Blanco County through 645 PM MDT... At 608 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 28 miles south of Rangely, or 42 miles north of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Rio Blanco County. This includes Colorado 139 between mile markers 38 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
